tasks.label: ğŸ’¼ Purge everything under a URL path prefix
tasks.detail: Use surrogate keys to link all objects under each path prefix, allowing wildcard purging of all URLs that share a common prefix.

tasks.label: âœˆï¸ Verify if a web crawler accessing your server really is Googlebot
tasks.detail: An implementation of Google's recommended mechanism for verifying googlebot

tasks.label: ğŸ›µ Add a new field to a JSON response
tasks.detail: Decorate API responses in JSON format with new fields.

tasks.label: ğŸ’¤ Populate template placeholders in streaming responses
tasks.detail: Use a transform stream to search the body of a response and replace simple template placeholders with content generated at the edge, without buffering.

tasks.label: ğŸš‹ Use a templating library at the edge
tasks.detail: Generate an invoice at the edge by rendering an HTML template with the full power of a popular template engine.

tasks.label: ğŸ’· Geo-IP API at the edge
tasks.detail: Create an API endpoint for fetching geolocation data for the requesting browser, implemented 100% at the edge. The response should show your current approximate location, but no requests to any origin servers.

tasks.label: ğŸ—„ï¸ Tag requests with geolocation data
tasks.detail: Add geolocation data about the client browser as extra headers in any requests from Fastly to your origin.

tasks.label: ğŸª Apply feature flags from an origin API
tasks.detail: Park request, make a different request first, use the response to annotate the real origin request (or make decisions about how to route it).

tasks.label: ğŸº Enforce a paywall using an origin API
tasks.detail: Use a custom Paywall header to trigger preflight requests to authenticate every article view with a backend paywall service.

tasks.label: ğŸŒŒ Detect leaked passwords
tasks.detail: Detect requests that contain submitted passwords and use a service to determine whether the password has leaked before allowing the request to proceed to origin (data from haveibeenpwned).

tasks.label: ğŸ«§ Convert timestamps to relative times like '2 hours ago'
tasks.detail: Generate relative time datelines at the Edge instead of in the browser or at origin. Better caching, faster rendering, fewer reflows.

tasks.label: ğŸ“§ Add www. to apex hostname and subdomains
tasks.detail: Detect requests that don't include a www. prefix, and redirect to the equivalent path on a hostname that starts with www., usually to make sure there's only one canonical location for your content.

tasks.label: ğŸ–‡ï¸ Override TTLs for path prefixes
tasks.detail: Set TTLs at the edge based on looking up a path prefix in a dictionary.

tasks.label: âš°ï¸ Push prices or breaking news in real time with Server-Sent-Events
tasks.detail: Stream responses to the browser while still receiving data from the origin and also saving it to cache. Great for spreading out server-sent-events streams to millions of users from a single source stream.

tasks.label: ğŸ“€ Map IPv6 addresses to IPv4 address space
tasks.detail: Create an identifier that looks like an IPv4 address if the user has made their request using IPv6. Useful for origin servers that require an IPv4 address for some reason.

tasks.label: â›„ Capture and aggregate log data from client devices
tasks.detail: Collect and aggregate log data submitted from browsers directly into S3 or another log store without having to handle the traffic at your origin.

tasks.label: ğŸ”‡ Use microservices to divide up a domain
tasks.detail: Send request to different origin servers based on the URL path.

tasks.label: ğŸ˜¸ Replace origin errors with 'safe' responses
tasks.detail: Detect specified response statuses from backends and instead serve a precomposed error page or error content generated at the edge.

tasks.label: ğŸ·ï¸ Answer CORS OPTIONS preflight requests at the edge
tasks.detail: Browsers send OPTIONS requests before performing cross-origin POSTs. You can answer these requests directly from the edge.

tasks.label: ğŸ¶ Apply HTTP basic auth to private endpoints
tasks.detail: Store username/password list in a dictionary, authorize user at the edge, reject requests that don't have correct credentials.

tasks.label: ğŸ““ Serve robots.txt from the edge
tasks.detail: Serve full text of robots.txt as a synthetic response to avoid requests hitting your origin.

tasks.label: ğŸš Load balance randomly across multiple backends
tasks.detail: Load balance requests randomly across multiple backends, dropping them automatically if they become unhealthy.

tasks.label: â­ Load balance to optimise upstream caching with hash directors
tasks.detail: Map requests to backends consistently, which can be useful to improve your internal cache and replication efficiency.

tasks.label: ğŸ”• Sticky sessions using client directors
tasks.detail: Map requests to backends based on user ID (a.k.a., "sticky sessions").

tasks.label: ğŸš¥ Log the data you need for actionable insights
tasks.detail: Emit logging data to your chosen log endpoint from any VCL stage, not just vcl_log.

tasks.label: ğŸ’… Serve small binary assets direct from edge
tasks.detail: Serve binary objects, such as images, directly from edge configuration.

tasks.label: ğŸ‘– Create self-destructing URLs for time-limited access
tasks.detail: Make URLs expire after a configurable period.

tasks.label: ğŸª Enable modern web security headers to all responses
tasks.detail: Go from an F to an A grade on securityheaders.io by adding security policy headers to your responses at the edge.

tasks.label: ğŸ”“ Add, remove or change HTTP headers
tasks.detail: Fastly can easily read and write HTTP headers at multiple stages of the request/response cycle.

tasks.label: ğŸª¬ Rewrite URL path
tasks.detail: Receive a request for one path but request a different path from origin, without a redirect.

tasks.label: ğŸš§ Filter query string parameters
tasks.detail: Add, remove, and sort querystring parameters.

tasks.label: ğŸŒ  Change request method
tasks.detail: Change PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS and others to POST, or vice versa, to help integrate incompatible client and server apps.

tasks.label: ğŸ£ Client public IP API at the edge
tasks.detail: Quickly fetch the user's public IP from an API endpoint on your own domain, with no origin.

tasks.label: ğŸ©¼ Add or remove cookies
tasks.detail: Read individual cookies, set new cookies in response.

tasks.label: ğŸ“” Filter cookies or other structured headers
tasks.detail: Rewrite headers to keep only keys that you want to allow, similar to `querystring.filter_except` but for headers rather than querystrings.

tasks.label: ğŸ¥» Remove trailing slashes to normalize URLs
tasks.detail: Treat URLs with and without suffixed slashes as equivalent, or redirect URLs with slashes to the version without.

tasks.label: ğŸ’£ Caching responses to POST requests
tasks.detail: By default, Fastly does not cache responses to POST requests. But you can enable this if you wish.

tasks.label: ğŸ‰ Regular expression capturing patterns
tasks.detail: Capture regex pattern groups to use in matching url segments and more.

tasks.label: ğŸ¥ Ban bad IPs for a fixed period
tasks.detail: Block a list of IP addresses from accessing your service and include an expiry time.

tasks.label: ğŸ“ª Apply CAPTCHA to high risk requests
tasks.detail: Intercept suspicious traffic and display a CAPTCHA challenge. If the user passes, allow the request to go to the origin server.

tasks.label: ğŸ‘» Normalize requests to increase cache efficiency
tasks.detail: Improve cache performance by normalizing requests. Filter and reorder query params, convert to lowercase, filter headers, and more.

tasks.label: ğŸª Search and replace in strings
tasks.detail: Use regular expression substitution functions to map paths, strip extraneous slashes, and more.

tasks.label: ğŸ˜½ Google Cloud Storage origin (public)
tasks.detail: Use a public GCS bucket as a backend for your Fastly service.

tasks.label: ğŸ’· Google Cloud Storage origin (private)
tasks.detail: Use AWS compat mode to make authenticated requests to your GCS bucket.

tasks.label: ğŸ›¬ Using S3-compatible buckets as private origins
tasks.detail: Configure S3-compatible buckets to use as private origins for CDN delivery. Requests are authorized via signature version 4 to protect communication between your CDN service and the bucket. This is compatible with Fastly Object Storage, AWS S3, and most other S3-compatible storage offerings.

tasks.label: ğŸš” Azure blob storage bucket origin (private)
tasks.detail: Use Microsoft Azure authenticated requests to protect communication between your Fastly service and Azure.

tasks.label: ğŸ›» Log request data to Google BigQuery
tasks.detail: Build raw JSON strings matching your BigQuery table schema to send log data to BigQuery.

tasks.label: ğŸ§© Base64 POST body
tasks.detail: Access the body of a POST request in Base64-encoded form.

tasks.label: ğŸ¤ Random integers
tasks.detail: Generate random whole numbers in a range.

tasks.label: ğŸª˜ Extract a substring from a string value
tasks.detail: Isolate a portion of a string identified by a range of characters.

tasks.label: â˜” POST to GET rewrite using a Base64-encoded querystring
tasks.detail: To allow caching of POST requests, consider rewriting them as GET requests at the edge.

tasks.label: â›´ï¸ Set PCI flag to disable persistent cache storage
tasks.detail: PCI-compliant caching requires caching only in volatile storage, which you can enable with beresp.pci in VCL.

tasks.label: ğŸ§» Smoke test a new origin
tasks.detail: Send a copy of your traffic to a test origin before returning a response from production.

tasks.label: ğŸ›©ï¸ Compute intersection of two lists
tasks.detail: Useful for comparing capabilities with required permissions.

tasks.label: ğŸ”Œ Prevent hotlinking of product images by third-party websites
tasks.detail: Detect and reject requests from third-party websites that attempt to embed your images on their pages.

tasks.label: ğŸ™ˆ Decompress and read gzipped responses
tasks.detail: When you need to work on API and text responses from backends that support gzip.

tasks.label: ğŸ§» Prohibit browser caching
tasks.detail: Ensure resources are not cached on the front end, while allowing caching within Fastly.

tasks.label: ğŸ‘¢ Assemble content at the edge with Edge-side includes (ESI)
tasks.detail: Use Fastly's support for ESI to combine multiple origin-hosted objects into a single response at the edge.

tasks.label: ğŸ“º Clean backend responses
tasks.detail: Remove headers added by backends that you don't want to emit to the browser, like amz- or goog- headers.

tasks.label: ğŸª¦ Follow redirects at the edge
tasks.detail: Protect clients from redirects by chasing them internally at the edge, and then return the eventual non-redirect response.

tasks.label: ğŸš§ Remove querystring from static assets
tasks.detail: Use the new Sec-Fetch-Dest header or URL patterns to identify assets that should not allow querystrings to be part of the cache key.

tasks.label: ğŸŒ©ï¸ Geofence / block access to content by region
tasks.detail: Group countries to cache content by custom regions or reject requests from some regions entirely.

tasks.label: ğŸ—» Cache 'near you' content for each area using lat/long grid
tasks.detail: Bucket users into small grid squares to allow for hyper-local content caching (e.g., "stores near you", "local offers").

tasks.label: ğŸª¢ Set Google Analytics _ga cookie
tasks.detail: Due to ITP 2.1 restrictions, cookies set in JavaScript may be limited to a 7-day TTL. Set your Google Analytics cookie on the edge to avoid this.

tasks.label: ğŸ§¤ Auto retry a secondary backend
tasks.detail: If primary backend fails, retry with a different backend without caching the failure or reducing cache efficiency.

tasks.label: ğŸ€ Anonymize client IPs for logging
tasks.detail: Strip the last octet or compute a hash of client IP address for anonymization.

tasks.label: ğŸ•¯ï¸ Log the IP version (IPv4/IPv6)
tasks.detail: Identify which type of IP address was used by the client connecting to your Fastly service.

tasks.label: âš—ï¸ Send HTTP Basic Auth in request to origin
tasks.detail: Convert a password sent by the client in the querystring into a Authorization header to your origin server.

tasks.label: ğŸ„ Cache POST/GraphQL query responses
tasks.detail: GraphQL query requests are POSTs, but responses to POST typically can't be cached. Convert it to a querystring on a GET request to allow Fastly to cache GraphQL (or any HTTP POST) request.

tasks.label: ğŸ• Base64 URL path segments
tasks.detail: Unknown data in URL paths can result in invalid URLs, but base64url is designed to be URL-safe.

tasks.label: ğŸ›¹ Check validity of inputs using a non-crypto hash
tasks.detail: Block or identify syntactically invalid requests at the edge by using a hash function of your choice.

tasks.label: ğŸ–¨ï¸ Authenticate JSON Web Tokens at the edge
tasks.detail: Decode the popular JWT format to verify user session tokens before forwarding trusted authentication data to your origin.

tasks.label: ğŸ˜» Use A/B testing to personalize responses
tasks.detail: Serve different responses to separate user cohorts.

tasks.label: ğŸš” Redirect old URLs at the edge
tasks.detail: Use a dictionary of URL mappings to serve your redirects at lightning speed.

tasks.label: ğŸ¥‹ Add time zone offset to requests
tasks.detail: Divide the world into time bands of custom size and forward time zone data to your origin server.

tasks.label: â˜‚ï¸ Format time expressions
tasks.detail: Format dates and times in a variety of ways.

tasks.label: ğŸ—ï¸ Perform redirects with wildcard patterns using a dictionary
tasks.detail: Match URL prefixes and make use of configurable response status and querystring preservation.

tasks.label: ğŸ Throttling per country over configurable time periods
tasks.detail: Adjust the maximum TCP socket pacing for connections at peak times of day in busy regions.

tasks.label: ğŸª— CenturyLink-compatible token validation
tasks.detail: Validate your CenturyLink tokens for access to video stream playlists.

tasks.label: ğŸ™ˆ Asynchronous origin requests with an ordered response
tasks.detail: Process multiple requests in any order and still generates the same output every time. This example uses an external API to retrieve the names of 10 Star Wars characters, the logs show how the requests run in a different order every time while the output never changes (provided no request fails).

tasks.label: ğŸï¸ Perform multiple origin requests asynchronously
tasks.detail: Handle third-party requests as they are resolved.

tasks.label: ğŸ§¥ Slowing down responses (tarpit)
tasks.detail: Force a response to be delivered very slowly to reduce the rate at which an attacker can send requests.

tasks.label: ğŸ”¨ Enrich image responses with EXIF metadata
tasks.detail: Use the `exif` Rust crate to decorate a backend response with image metadata.

tasks.label: ğŸ“¬ Generate a QR code
tasks.detail: Use open source libraries to dynamically serve a QR code based on query parameters.

tasks.label: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Use dynamic backends to follow redirects
tasks.detail: Create a dynamic backend from the redirect response, and then get a response from the dynamic backend.

tasks.label: ğŸœï¸ Validate domain on query string
tasks.detail: Check the query string if it contains a valid domain.

tasks.label: ğŸ± Backend health status API
tasks.detail: Create an HTTP API for real time backend health status

tasks.label: ğŸ‘¢ Check for viruses using Virus Total
tasks.detail: Sha256 hash a file upload and test the hash against the VirusTotal API

tasks.label: â³ Protect PNGs for Acropalypse
tasks.detail: Remove extraneous data from PNG files created using screenshotting tools

tasks.label: ğŸ§° Transform a response while streaming it
tasks.detail: Streaming transformations avoid buffering a response, reducing latency and memory consumption

tasks.label: ğŸ”Œ Set a timeout on a Request
tasks.detail: Configure a timeout for a specific origin request, rather than relying on the configuration settings for that origin

tasks.label: ğŸ‹ Conduct security chaos experiments in requests
tasks.detail: Strips cookies and forces cross-site origin headers in requests to verify security controls and logging are working as expected.

tasks.label: ğŸ“Š Block bad user-agents
tasks.detail: Check for known bad bots and crawlers and deny traffic.

tasks.label: ğŸ’‰ Rewrite url based on the subdomain
tasks.detail: Check for a subdomain and rewrite the URL path.

tasks.label: ğŸ¦¼ Deny access to certain file types
tasks.detail: Check for specific URL extensions and deny access with a 403.

tasks.label: ğŸš¨ Block all traffic from certain countries
tasks.detail: Check for a country code on an incoming request, and if it's present, deny access with a 403.

tasks.label: ğŸ”® Use surrogate key purges for purge-all and single URL purge
tasks.detail: Surrogate key purges are fast and flexible and can be used in place of single URL purge and purge-all.

tasks.label: ğŸ©° Use regionally distributed origin servers
tasks.detail: If you have multiple hosting locations, Fastly can route traffic to the closest one.

tasks.label: ğŸ¥‡ Pass all requests
tasks.detail: Disable edge caching and skip the Fastly readthrough cache for every request, ensuring nothing is cached at the edge.

tasks.label: ğŸš• Read environment variables
tasks.detail: Read values from Fastly-defined env vars in Compute programs.

tasks.label: ğŸ“² Register a dynamic backend
tasks.detail: Backends can be defined at runtime in compute applications to make requests to any host on the internet.

tasks.label: ğŸ©¹ Calculate the distance between two points on Earth
tasks.detail: Calculate the physical geo distance in kilometers between places such as the end user's location and the Fastly POP they connected to.
